Question
========
T-values are given with the output of a regression analysis. Which of the statements below about the T-value is correct?

Answerlist
----------
* The T-value is the B/SE (standard error): how much SE is the B away from 0.
* The T-value is the Beta/SE (standard error): how much SE is the Beta away from 0 off.
* The T-value is the comparison between the values of the independent variables. At *p* &lt; .05 it is significant.
* The T-value is the comparison between the values of the independent variables. At *p* &gt; .05 it is significant.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* True
* False
* False
* False
